intro: Bivonaea albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower bivonaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Bivonaea albiflora is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
